Data from 0.2 to 30 micrometers are from Table 4 of O.B. Toon et al.,
The optical constants of several atmospheric aerosol species:  
Ammonium Sulfate, Aluminum Oxide, and Sodium Chloride, J. Geophys. 
Res., 81, 5733-5748, 1976.  The relfectances of these data are set to
0.0.  Data beyond 32 micrometers are created using the Lorentz line 
parameters given in Toon et al. and these could be recalculated at 
any spectral resolution.  Range of validity is given as 333-100 
inverse centimeters.

high frq. dielec. const=  2.327
Lorentz line parameters
center  width  strength
 247.0  0.1410  0.0900
 164.0  0.0370  3.2000
  83.0  1.6490  0.3300
